info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 4 at 6:12AM CDT until July 4 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
FFWSJT
The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Tom Green County in west central Texas...
* Until 915 AM CDT.
* At 608 AM CDT, Local law enforcement reported major flooding and very dangerous conditions across San Angelo. Do not drive on the roads, as many roads are flooded and low water crossings are impassable! Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing.
This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for San Angelo. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW!
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Law enforcement reported.
IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Angelo, O.c. Fisher Reservoir, San Angelo State Park, Lake Nasworthy, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Grape Creek, Carlsbad and Wall.
info.instruction:
Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR SAN ANGELO
NWS: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY this area til 9:15 AM CDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY is in effect for this area until 9:15 AM CDT. This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR SAN ANGELO
SNM: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 9:15 AM CDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 9:15 AM CDT. Esta es una situacion extremadamente peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
